  5. register = Library()
  7. RE_SIZE = re.compile(r'(\d+)x(\d+)$')
  10. def _recalculate_size(size, index, divisor=0, padding=0,
  11. keep_aspect_ratio=False):
  12. new_one = size[index]
  13. if divisor:
  14. new_one = new_one / float(divisor)
  15. if padding:
  16. new_one = new_one - padding
  17. if keep_aspect_ratio:
  18. new_two = int(float(new_one) * \
  19. float(size[int(not index)]) / size[index])
  20. else:
  21. new_two = int(size[int(not index)])
  23. new_one = int(new_one)
  24. if index:
  25. return (new_two, new_one)
  26. return new_one, new_two
  29. def _resize(original_size, index, divisor=0, padding=0,
  30. keep_aspect_ratio=False):
  31. if isinstance(original_size, basestring):
  32. m = RE_SIZE.match(original_size)
  33. if m:
  34. original_size = (int(m.group(1)), int(m.group(2)))
  35. else:
  36. return original_size
  37. else:
  38. try:
  39. original_size = (int(original_size[0]), int(original_size[1]))
  40. except (TypeError, ValueError):
  41. return original_size
  42. try:
  43. padding = int(padding)
  44. divisor = int(divisor)
  45. except (TypeError, ValueError):
  46. return original_size
  47. # Re-calculate size
  48. new_x, new_y = _recalculate_size(original_size, index, divisor=divisor,
  49. padding=padding,
  50. keep_aspect_ratio=keep_aspect_ratio)
  51. return (new_x, new_y)
  54. def extra_padding_x(original_size, padding):
  55. """
  56. Reduce the width of `original_size` by `padding`
  57. """
  58. return _resize(original_size, 0, padding=padding)
  59. extra_padding_x = register.filter(extra_padding_x)
  62. def extra_padding_x_keep_ratio(original_size, padding):

  64. Reduce the width of `original_size` by `padding`, maintaining the aspect
  65. ratio.
  66. """
  67. return _resize(original_size, 0, padding=padding, keep_aspect_ratio=True)

  71. def extra_padding_y(original_size, padding):
  72. """
  73. Reduce the height of `original_size` by `padding`
